newsitem.title: JAPAN: Softbank says detail on JSkyB not yet decided.
newsitem.headline: Softbank says detail on JSkyB not yet decided.

text.p: Softbank Corp executive vice president Ken Miyauchi said on Wednesday that details of the satellite broadcasting venture Japan Sky Broadcasting (JSkyB) have not yet been decided.

"The discussion on JSkyB is still going on," said Miyauchi, who was attending a news conference to announce a business tie-up between Softbank, Microsoft Corp and Uchida Yoko, a firm that trades in office equipment.
Asked about the possibility that Softbank would not be included in the satellite broadcasting venture, Miyauchi said: "There is no possibility that Softbank would leave the project."
JSkyB is a joint venture between Softbank and News Corp led by the media tycoon Rupert Murdoch. The two firms are currently negotiating with Sony Corp about its capital participation in the venture.
JSkyB is scheduled to start beaming 12 channels into Japan later this month.
